response.job_title: Associate Researcher at Universidad Nacional de Colombia
response.summary: My experience as a neurologist and my solid training in health economics have allowed me to identify the main questions of clinical specialists in multiple areas of pharmacoeconomics and health economics in general. I also consider that my background as a neurologist, combined with my economic training and my extensive statistical and epidemiological experience, will allow me to carry out comprehensive economic evaluations from a clinical and economic point of view. On the other hand, this background also allows me to communicate the relevant pharmacoeconomic concepts in a more accurate way with my clinical peers from a perspective that they consider reliable and from someone with whom they can share achievements, challenges, and expectations of the sector.
response.skills: Data Manipulation, Clinical Research, Medicine, Healthcare, Wellness, Research, Economics, Healthcare Information Technology (HIT), Statistics, Epidemiology, Microsoft Excel, Stata, Communication, Problem Solving, Health Economics, Health Technology Assessment (HTA), Outcomes Research

profile_positions.description:
• Statistical analysis of large administrative databases provided by the Ministry of Health and Social Protection for the generation of quantitative evidence in health economics
• Search and synthesis of clinical and economics evidence to support the development of health technology assessments 
• Writing of manuscripts in English and Spanish for submission to national and international indexed journals
profile_positions.title: Associate Researcher

profile_positions.description: My experience as a neurologist and my solid training in health economics have allowed me to identify the main questions of clinical specialists in multiple areas of pharmacoeconomics and health economics in general. I also consider that my background as a neurologist, combined with my economic training and my extensive statistical and epidemiological experience, will allow me to carry out comprehensive economic evaluations from a clinical and economic point of view. On the other hand, this background also allows me to communicate the relevant pharmacoeconomic concepts in a more accurate way with my clinical peers from a perspective that they consider reliable and from someone with whom they can share achievements, challenges, and expectations of the sector.
profile_positions.title: MSc. Health Economics

profile_positions.description:
A private company that provides neurology health care services to inpatients at a general clinic and referral center that treats highly complex medical conditions.
Key Responsibility:
• To diagnose and treat patients with neurological conditions
who attend an outpatient clinic.
Inpatients neurology consultations, including diagnosis and
treatment of neurological diseases, mostly meningitis, stroke
and AIDS-related complications.
• Academic activities with post-graduate and medicine students
including seminars, topic reviews, and case presentations.
profile_positions.title: Neurologist

profile_positions.description:
General University Hospital that is interested in education as well as research activities in the areas of emergency medicine, internal medicine, and pediatrics.
Key Responsibilities:
• Outpatients neurology service, including first-time consultations and follow up of patients with neurological diseases including mostly epilepsy, movement disorders, and stroke.
• Inpatients neurology consultations, including diagnosis and treatment of neurological diseases, mostly meningitis, stroke, and AIDS-related complications.
• Academic activities with post-graduate and medicine students including seminars, topic reviews, and case presentations.
• Designing and conducting clinical trials, as the first author and on behalf of the Hospital Santa Clara clinical research group.
profile_positions.title: Neurologist

company.name: National University of Colombia. Clinical Research Institute, Faculty of Medicine. Project "National

profile_positions.company: National University of Colombia. Clinical Research Institute, Faculty of Medicine. Project "National
profile_positions.description:
National guideline project on diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of patients with acute stroke. These guidelines were developed according to the recommendations made by the GRADE working group and advising from NICE, the Guideline International Network, and the Cochrane Collaboration.
Key Responsibilities:
• To design and conduct the systematic reviews that collected the evidence to assess the effectiveness of the interventions and, the economic evaluations
• To perform the critical review of the gathered evidence and run the GRADE instruments to grade the quality of evidence and the strength of the recommendations generated by the guideline
• To contribute to the final drafting of the guide manuscript
profile_positions.title: Thematic expert

company.name: Paediatric Cardiology Foundation. Research Institute. Project "National Clinical Guideline for Diagn

profile_positions.company: Paediatric Cardiology Foundation. Research Institute. Project "National Clinical Guideline for Diagn
profile_positions.description:
National guideline project on diagnosis and treatment of adult patients with hypertension. These guidelines were developed according to the recommendations made by the GRADE working group and advising from NICE, the Guideline International Network, and the Cochrane Collaboration.
Key Responsibilities:
• To design and conduct the systematic reviews that collected the evidence to assess the effectiveness of the interventions and the economic evaluations
• To perform the critical review of the gathered evidence and run the GRADE instruments to grade the quality of evidence and the strength of the recommendations generated by the guideline
• To contribute to the final drafting of the guide manuscript
profile_positions.title: Methodologic expert

profile_positions.description:
University focused on engineering and health education with special interests in cardiovascular and genetic research.
Key Responsibilities:
• Responsible for recruitment from several sites in Bucaramanga for the POISE study: a randomized controlled trial for evaluating the effects of metoprolol in patients with intermediate and high cardiovascular risk undergoing noncardiac surgery. A study designed and conducted by McMaster University (Hamilton, Ontario) and supported by the Population Health Research Institutes of Canada.
• Responsible for follow-up visits and medical assessment from patients recruited in the CHICAMOCHA study: a cohort study for determining the risk factors for the development of chronic myocardiopathy in patients with the undetermined form of Chagas disease. Study design and conducted by UNAB and
supported by UNAB and Colciencias (Colombian Institute for research and technology development).
profile_positions.title: Assistant researcher

education.field_of_study: Servicios sanitarios/Ciencias de la salud, general
